Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: Company failed to correct royalty reports to reflect Index Zone prices.
Agency: Interior Department Office of Natural Resources Revenue

Description: Marathon Oil agreed to pay $7.7 million to resolve claims under the False Claims Act and administrative claims that the Houston-based corporation underpaid royalties due for oil produced on federal and Indian leases between 1988 and 1998.

Dominion Oklahoma Texas Exploration & Production Inc. and Marathon Oil Company agreed to pay the United States $2,219,974.98 and $4,697,476.57, respectively, to resolve claims that the two companies separately violated the False Claims Act by knowingly underpaying royalties owed on natural gas produced from federal and Indian leases.

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Notes: Year is fiscal year. Date is closing date.

Description: Marathon Oil Co. agreed to pay over $400,000 in settlement of allegations it violated state and federal laws as a result of oil pipeline spills in 16 Illinois counties.
Marathon Oil Co. agreed to pay $22,000 in settlement of allegations it violated underground storate tank regulations at an abandoned gasoline station.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 211111: Crude Petroleum and Natural Gas Extraction
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
